basics.name: Darrius Dacquel
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences with a Minor in Japanese at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

education.area: Computer Science w/ Minor in Japanese (expected Spring, 2025)

work.summary: Leading archive digitization and enhancing legal research access at UH Manoa Law Library. I support law students with their research needs and coordinate library projects, maintaining high standards in administrative tasks.
highlights: Led the digitization of archives, enhancing the preservation and accessibility of historical documents.
Contributed to the planning and execution of special projects, events, displays, and workshops in collaboration with library staff.
Ensured meticulous attention to detail in administrative tasks including data entry, record management, and report generation.
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
